description.narrative: Output 5.5. Poor and vulnerable Social Welfare Fund beneficiaries continue to receive lifesaving unconditional emergency cash transfer, which contributes to Economic And Social Policy General, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Adolescent girls and boys, mothers and fathers, and community leaders in 106 districts adopt 11 key life-saving, care and protective behaviours for children and women

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers - social protection data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)

National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Support to cash transfer delivery by government system (humanitarian context)

description.narrative: General Economic, Commercial and Labour Affairs policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.5. Poor and vulnerable Social Welfare Fund beneficiaries continue to receive lifesaving unconditional emergency cashtransfer

description.narrative: Two payments have taken place in 2020, covering 1.43 million poor and vulnerable beneficiaries of the unconditional cash transfer programme, impacting over 9.16 million people - almost a third of the country&39;s population. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/01/2021
